level.text: 4204.1 To qualify for a license by examination, an applicant shall:
Meet the education requirements set forth under § 4202 of this chapter; and
Receive a passing score on the following:
Part I and Part II of the examination of the Joint Commission on National Dental Examinations;
The Northeast Regional Board (NERB) or the American Board of Dental Examiners (ADEX) Examination, which shall include a passing score on the Periodontal Examination; and
The District of Columbia Dental Law Examination.
To apply for a license by examination, an applicant shall:
Submit a completed application to the Board on the required forms and include:
The applicant’s social security number on the application; and
Two (2) recent passport-type photographs of the applicant’s face measuring two inches by two inches (2″ x 2″) which clearly expose the area from the top of the forehead to the bottom of the chin.

Submit an official certificate of graduation in a sealed envelope from the educational institution(s) to the Board, which shall verify that the applicant meets the educational requirements set forth under § 4202 of this chapter;
Submit the applicant’s examination results, which have been certified or validated by the NERB or the ADEX, whichever is applicable, and the Joint Commission of National Dental Examiners;
Pass the District of Columbia Dental Law Examination; and
The passing scores on the examination shall be those established by the Joint Commission on National Dental Examinations and NERB or ADEX on each test that forms a part of the examination.

An applicant who has successfully completed the NERB or the ADEX examination ten (10) or more years prior to the date of receipt by the Board of the application for licensure shall be required to retake the NERB or ADEX examination, unless the applicant is applying for licensure by endorsement pursuant to § 4209 of this chapter.
